abstract: Top stories in the news Tuesday morning.
snippet: Top stories in the news Tuesday morning.
lead_paragraph: The leader of the movement to carve a separate state out of Andhra Pradesh rejected Prime Minister Manmohan Singh's plea on Monday to end the ongoing agitation and provide more time to resolve the issue. (The Hindu) K. Chandrasekhar Rao, who had previously gone on a hunger strike in 2009, threatened again to fast to death unless the center came out with a clear-cut announcement mentioning a time frame within which the state of Telangana would be formed. "People are dying every day for the cause of Telangana," Rao said.Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Omar Abdullah on Monday threatened to sue opposition leader Mehbooba Mufti for claiming he was involved in the death of a party worker (Hindustan Times). In a blistering statement during a swiftly convened news conference, Abdullah said he was ready to appear before the panel probing the matter. The Jammu and Kashmir Assembly adjourned Monday after members swapped abuses (Indian Express).

headline.main: Newswallah: In the English-Language Press Tuesday
